title: Two killed in shooting at Devundara
byline: Two individuals were killed in a shooting incident on Sinhasana Road, in front of the southern entrance of the Devundara Sri Vishnu Devalaya, at around 11:45 p.m. last night (21), according to police.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, North-Western, and Northern provinces, as well as in the Anuradhapura, Galle, and Matara districts after 2:00 p.m.

title: Another suspect arrested in connection with ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder
byline: A 23-year-old suspect has been arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting the murder of notorious criminal figure and drug trafficker Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne, also known as “Ganemulla Sanjeewa.”

title: Columbia agrees to Trump’s demands in attempt to restore funding
byline: Columbia University has agreed to changes demanded by the Trump administration as a precondition for restoring $400 million in federal funding that was pulled this month over allegations the school tolerated antisemitism on campus.

title: “Acting in people’s interest”: Opposition MP justifies support for 2025 Budget
byline: Sri Lanka Labour Party’s Vanni District Parliamentarian, Kader Masthan, voted in favor of the 2025 Budget during its third reading vote in Parliament on Friday (21), breaking ranks with the opposition.

title: Sri Lanka’s Nadun Kaveesha advances to 60m Hurdles semi-finals at World Indoor Athletics Championships
byline: Sri Lanka’s Nadun Kaveesha secured a spot in the semi-finals of the Men’s 60m Hurdles at the World Indoor Athletics Championships in Nanjing, China, today (22).

title: ‘Out of my own pocket’: Trump suggests paying overtime to astronauts back from space
byline: Two NASA astronauts spent 278 extra days on the International Space Station after their spacecraft malfunctioned, but aren’t eligible for overtime pay.

title: SJB nominates Dr. Ruvaiz Haniffa as Colombo Mayor candidate
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has officially nominated Dr. Ruvaiz Haniffa as its candidate for the position of Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: 350 kg of Kerala cannabis seized in Point Pedro
byline: Sri Lanka Police have seized 154 parcels containing nearly 350 kilograms of Kerala cannabis, which had been smuggled into the country from India.

title: Hassan Alaldeen named Sarvajana Balaya’s Colombo Mayoral candidate
byline: Hassan Alaldeen has been officially nominated as the mayoral candidate for the Colombo Municipal Council by the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance.

title: Indonesia’s Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano erupts; some Bali flights cancelled
byline: An eruption of Indonesia’s Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano spewed ash clouds more than 8 kilometres (5 miles) high, authorities said as they raised the alert status to the highest level, and an Australian airline cancelled some flights into Bali on Friday.

title: Police investigate ‘Bale Malli’ as prime suspect in Devinuwara double murder
byline: Police have uncovered new details regarding the double murder that occurred last night (21) in front of the ‘Devundara Sri Vishnu Devalaya’ in Devinuwara, with investigations pointing to notorious criminal Shehan Sathsara, infamously known as “Bale Malli”, as the prime suspect behind the crime.

title: PM’s Secretary engages with global experts at World Bank’s Digital Summit
byline: The Secretary to the Prime Minister, Pradeep Saputhanthri, participated in the World Bank Group’s Global Digital Summit 2025, held from March 17 to 20 at the World Bank headquarters in Washington, D.C.

title: Mobile app introduced to submit LG Election complaints
byline: A new mobile application has been introduced for submitting complaints related to the 2025 Local Government (LG) Elections today (22).
